biotools.summary: Differential Network Analysis in R. Reveals hidden patterns of plant signaling dynamics. DiNAR presents three main functions: dynamic visualisation of complex multi-conditional experiments, identification of strong differential interactions, and recall of latent effects that are present in multi-conditional experiments. Furthermore, it can manage other background knowledge networks in combination with experimental dataset of interest such as transcriptomics, proteomics, metabolomics.
